dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY CARVER (mid-20s, good looking, "romantic") is sitti at his desk, depressed, staring at a photo of his ex- girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy Boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. BANKS (mid-20s, always looking for a good time) ente the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your ass ready! It's almost five o'clock and this bad boy needs to get his drink on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. notices his friend pining over the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God. Give me that.     I'm burning it once and for all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. snatches the photo, and pulls out his lighter. Just the flame is about to touch the photo, BILLY grabs it bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, it's been six months.    You have to move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY nods knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what'll cheer you up? Some hot chick riding your jock all night long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a romantic, J.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would help get your mind off of Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY ponders this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Even if I wanted to meet other women, I wouldn't even know what to do. I've been out of the game so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, you come out with me tonight, and I promise you'll get laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds tempting, but I can't. Berenson needs me to update the financial models for his meeting with the foreign investors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? It's Friday!      You have all weekend to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't. The Germans are taking an earlier flight back, so the meeting's been moved to tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why don't you just get somebody else to do your work then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. gets a big smile on his face.    He has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD LEE (22 years old, the typical Asian-American workhorse you'll find in any investment bank) is packing his briefcase, getting ready to leave for the day. BILLY and J.D. approach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold, listen, I need you to update these models for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) But aren't you supposed to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but something came up. I have to meet with some clients tonight, so I won't be able to get to it. It's your responsibility now. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold doesn't like this, but before he even has a chance protest, J.D. steps forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And make sure it's in tomorrow by nine o'clock sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. (cont'd) With all the downsizing going on around here, we wouldn't want to have to tell Berenson that you've been slacking. He's just dying to figure out who he should fire next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...okay...no problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY drops a big stack of papers on Harold's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY and J.D. are walking through the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!   I can't believe how easy that was!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, how do you think I get all my shit done? I'm telling you -- those Asian guys love crunching numbers. You probably just made his weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys have reached J.D.'S CONVERTIBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy and J.D. enter the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get ready. It's time we embark on...Operation Get Some!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, J.D. presses a button in his car that caus the top of the convertible to go down and a funky white b song kicks in. Intercut:

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. J.D'S CONVERTABLE
dialogues.text: Billy and J.D. think they're hot shit as they cruise thro the parking lot blasting their tunes. When the lyrics kic in, J.D. begins lip-syncing passionately. Billy loves it. When the chorus begins, the guys begin dancing in their s in an unrealistic, synchronized, choreographed manner. J.D. gives a thumbs up to an ELDERLY PARKING ATTENDANT as car zooms out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK BOOM UP from J.D.'s Convertible and PUSH IN to Haro standing at a window watching as Billy and J.D. zoom off. He looks at the stack of papers they gave him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR PATEL (22, Indian, Funky Hair) is answering questio from his NYU Medical School interviewer, DR. Woodruff (mi aged, erudite, very professional). Kumar has NO ACCENT. He's American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mononucleosis or mono is an infection caused by the Epstein-Barr virus. Symptoms may include fever, sore throat, headaches, white patches on the back of your throat, swollen glands, sluggishness and loss of appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent, Kumar. I have to say you're one of the best applicants I've ever interviewed. Not that it's a surprise. Your father is very respected in his field. You know he and I had some pretty wild times when we were in med school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We started our own basketball team-- the Hemoglobin Trotters... (cracking up) Yeah, we were crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar nods and smiles.   Woodruff finally stops laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway-- just one more question. (reading from a clipboard) What are some potential symptoms of pancreatitis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see. There might be epigastric tenderness, diffuse abdominal tenderness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, we hear what sounds like be a match being lit, gurgle, and a cough -- the distinct sounds of somebody smoking from a bong. Dr. Woodruff is confused. Kumar pull out his cell phone. It's his personalized ringer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES     MAY 28 2003   5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dr. Woodruff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Can you hold on one second? Kumar stands up and answers his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar's phone. Kumar speaking. (listening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. (listening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing important. I can talk. What's up? Dr. Woodruff is offended. He takes a sip of from a mug of coffee and watches as Kumar begins pacing around the offi Intercut:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold is talking on his office phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna be able to partake in our usual Friday night ritual. I've gotta stay late at the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that shit! We had plans! Dr. Woodruff can't believe Kumar's choice of words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I gotta get this work done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on! When has getting high ever prevented you from finishing your work? Dr. Woodruff is so shocked that the mug of coffee simply slips out of his hands. Hot coffee goes all over his shir Woodruff yells and starts wiping his shirt with a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'd love to go home, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fucking buts! I just bought a quarter of the finest herb in New York City, and I'm not smoking it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES MAY 28 2003         6. KUMAR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're just gonna have to chill the fuck out, bring your work home, and prepare to get blazed, because in a couple of hours I expect both of us to be blitzed out of our skulls. Got it?...Okay good. See you later. Kumar hangs up the phone and sits back down.      Dr. Woo stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dr. Woodruff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, where was I? Oh yes. More symptoms of pancreatitis. Um...decreased bowel sounds, possibly fever, dehydration, and sometimes even shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (livid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Patel. This is supposed to be a proper interview. Do you actually believe after the way you've behaved that I would ever even consider recommending you for admission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    I'd actually be pretty surprised. Dr. Woodruff is flustered.   He doesn't know how to react

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm just interviewing so my dad will keep paying for my apartment. I'm not really planning on going to med school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...you have perfect MCAT scores!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not an idiot. Dr. Woodruff is at a loss for words. Kumar notices a framed picture of a HOT TEENAGE GIRL on D Woodruff's desk. He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!    Is this your daughter? A disturbed Dr. Woodruff grabs the portrait out of Kumar' hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold shuts down his laptop. He then puts the laptop alo with all his paperwork into a bag and leaves the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold walks to the end of the parking lot, where his car parked. As he walks, the strap of his laptop bag breaks a falls to the ground. Harold is frustrated as he picks it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After other cars zoom through uninterrupted, the ELDERLY PARKING ATTENDANT stops Harold and checks his ID before letting him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold's driving his WHITE INFINITI G20. He finds a spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!   Right in front...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold carefully lines up his car to parallel park. As he starts to pull in, A YELLOW JEEP STEALS THE SPOT FROM BEH The jeep is loaded with "alternative" stickers, and has a KAYAK, HANG-GLIDER, and other sports equipment on the roo Harold almost hits the JEEP. He knows this car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated, to himself) Those assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, COLE (20's, asshole, high energy, intense, lo mouth), puts down his window... COLE is joined in the jeep with his EXTREME SPORTS PUNK FRIENDS, who all laugh at Harold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock Asian accent) This is America, dude! Learn how to drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better ruck tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Harold turns around and continues driving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ends up parking far from the building. He has to paral park. He's anal with his parking, going in and out a bunc of times, until the car is positioned perfectly in the sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold walks a bunch of blocks to his apartment building. walks up the steps to the LOBBY ENTRANCE of his building. Suddenly, he stops in his tracks. Through the glass door, sees... MARIA-- A beautiful, sweet-looking young woman of Puerto-Rican descent. She's standing by the elevators. HAROLD can't move. He's mesmerized. This is his dream gir Harold takes a deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, be yourself. Don't be nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold enters the building and walks over to Maria. They give each other a friendly smile. We hear a "BING" sound, indicating the elevator has arrived. The doors open and Harold and Maria walk inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and MARIA are standing silently as the elevator go up. Eventually, Harold gets the courage to speak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Maria, what's been going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing. It's just been a long week. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My week was great. Work wasn't too bad. I caught up on some sleep. Plus, the guy who works next to me decided to bathe for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Oh wait, I meant the exact opposite of that. Work sucked. I barely slept. And the guy next to me still smells like crap. But a man can dream, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria laughs.   Harold's pleased that his joke worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you up to tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm probably gonna work out a little bit, clean up the apartment, and then go over to my boyfriend's place. He's cooking me a really nice dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Oh wait, I meant the exact opposite of that. (beat) I'll actually probably just sit on my ass, eat a pint of Hagaan Daz, and watch Blind Date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playful) That sounds awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold laughs, as does Maria.    They smile at each other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you want some company, maybe you could sit on your ass at my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flirty) Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the "BING" of the elevator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back in the lobby. EVERYTHING THAT JUST HAPPENED WA FANTASY. Harold and Maria enter the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and MARIA stand silently while the elevator goes u It's clear Harold wants to say something, but he doesn't the courage. They reach their floor and exit the elevator

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA walks over to her apartment and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired and frustrated, Harold enters his apartment. The pl is minimally decorated, with one of the highlights being poster of "BILLY MADISON."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold walks over to Kumar's room and looks inside. It's Martha Stewart's nightmare-- dirty laundry all over the floor, etc. On his walls we see old school gangsta rap posters. MARIJUANA PARAPHERNALIA is everywhere. We see a Giant Photograph of Kumar with his arm around Mr. T. Kuma is not in the room, however.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, Harold walks over to HIS ROOM (neat, tidy, IKEA furnishings), where he sees KUMAR STANDING BUTT NAKED IN FRONT OF A FULL-LENGTH MIRROR. There's a "clipping sound" coming from Kumar's direction. Harold stares at him, shoc and appalled. Harold walks inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar, what the hell are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trimming my pubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar looks at himself in the mirror as he makes a couple more snips. On the floor, we see LARGE CLUMPS OF HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you doing this in your room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mirror's in here. (re: his crotch) Hey, check it out! It looks like a Bonsai tree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna puke. Get your clothes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill out. It makes my Johnson look bigger. Besides, if I don't do this, I'll end up with pubes like my dad. You've seen Osama Bin Laden's beard, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD notices something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those my scissors? Oh my God!     I trim my nose hair with those!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I've been cutting my ass hair with them for the past six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET THE HELL OUT OF MY ROOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar puts the scissors down and EXITS THE ROOM. Harold shakes his head and sets up his laptop on his desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar puts on some boxers and a T-shirt (I love Bush: the pussy not the president).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out to Harold) So what the hell is your problem, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other than my roommate's boney ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold turns on his laptop and is ready to start working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) One of the senior analysts asked me to do a bunch of his work for him tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar walks back into Harold's room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume you gave him the appropriate "go fuck yourself."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If by "go fuck yourself" you mean "no problem sir" then yes, he got the message loud and clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR shakes his head in disgust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Harold takes this all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you in here for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assaulting an officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tried to pin that shit on you too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I actually did hit the cop. But only because I was trying to hit my friend. Well, ex-friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, OFFICER REILLY hangs up the phone on his desk. shouts out to the other officers in the room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, listen up guys! Multiple gun shots fired in Millbrook Park! It sounds bad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, some action! I'm going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another cop, OFFICER MARTONE, gets up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- I'm going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All six officers in the room jump out of their desks and for the door. Harold and Tarik can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the officers get into their POLICE CARS and drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Tarik are now left all alone in their cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a loud banging sound is made from a VENTILATION SHAFT on the ceiling, above one of the officer's desks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from inside the shaft) Rold? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES    MAY 28 2003   77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although his voice is muffled, we can hear Kumar's words. Tarik is very confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar?! What the fuck are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the cops still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they...   Wait a second, did you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called and made up some story about a shooting in Millbrook park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! What did you do that for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fucking starving! I figured I'd bust you out, and we'd get over to White Castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it! I don't want to get in any more trouble! I'm already in here because of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fuck you! What did you want me to do? Stand there and take the hit? You know, I've never taken a swing at you before. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I never got your car stolen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm trying to read here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Rold, I'm sorry. But you're not the only one dealing with shit. My dad's cutting me off, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey asshole, I'm in jail! Don't bitch to me about your problems! Just leave me alone. I don't want your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want my help? Fine!    I'm outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a couple banging sounds from the ventilation shaf Then a couple more. Then a couple more. Pouting, Harold pretends to ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Rold?    How do I get out of here? Tarik rolls his eyes in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't good. We hear the banging noise again. And again. Suddenly, THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Tarik shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow...my ass. Kumar gets up and walks over to the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want to get out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And become a fugitive? Are you nuts? The guy has all my information. Harold points to Palumbo's desk, which has the police rep Harold's I.D., and his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? We'll take everything he wrote down about you and leave. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you want to stay here all night and not be able to hand your work in tomorrow. Harold thinks about this for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.    Hurry up. Kumar smiles.   He begins searching for a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see ALL THE POLICE CARS RETURNING TO THE STATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar finds A BIG METAL KEY RING on Palumbo's desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I was hoping it would be one of these big ring of keys. Now I get to try all of them to see which one will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar, hurry the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar runs over to the cell door. He tries out a couple keys, when he suddenly smells something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar turns his head and sees the ENORMOUS BAG OF WEED on Officer Reilly's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar?...Kumar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar can't hear Harold. He's in a trance. We begin to he romantic song as Kumar stares lovingly at the BAG OF WEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful, sunny day in the park, as KUMAR pushes BAG OF WEED on a swing, like young lovers do in movies...

dialogues.speaker: INT. MINIATURE GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: KUMAR has his arms around THE BAG OF WEED as he helps it swing the golf club. It's a hole in one! KUMAR TURNS THE BAG OF WEED AROUND AND GIVES IT A KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar and THE BAG OF WEED are sitting down, posing for a CARICATURE SKETCH ARTIST. The Artist reveals his sketch t Kumar and The Bag of Weed. It obviously looks ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAG OF WEED is lying on KUMAR's bed, while KUMAR give a massage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR is lying on the bed, while THE BAG OF WEED is givin him a massage (yes, the bag has little arms and hands now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAG OF WEED is holding a box containing pictures and memorabilia of it's relationship to the HIPPIE ASSHOLE. T Bag of Weed throws the box in a GARBAGE CAN. Kumar lights a match and throws it in the can, setting it aflame. He and the bag of weed face each other and kiss..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NAKED KUMAR and THE BAG OF WEED are kissing in bed. The BAG OF WEED starts to go under the covers. We watch, as t sheets move up and down. KUMAR STARTS TO HAVE AN ORGASM.. THE BAG OF WEED comes up from under the covers. Kumar giv it a kiss. THEN, HE GOES UNDER THE COVERS. We see THE BAG OF WEED START TO TREMBLE AND SHUDDER IN ECSTASY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR (wearing a wife-beater undershirt and boxers) is frustrated as he looks at his BILLS. THE BAG OF WEED (wea a pink bathrobe) comes out of the kitchen holding a MUG O

dialogues.speaker: DEPRESSED, THE BAG OF WEED WALKS AWAY FROM THE TABLE...
dialogues.text: KUMAR hears THE BAG OF WEED crying from the other room. obviously feels guilty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar walks away from the cell, goes over to the desk, pi up the bag of weed and caresses it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, all six police officer come back into the room, pushing a black man wearing pajamas (NATHANIEL BANKS). Nathaniel seems very gentle. He's even wearing a turtlene sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nathaniel) You thought you could get away with this, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? I was in bed.         I didn't fire any gun, I swear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Officer Reilly looks over to the jail cell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the cops turn to the cell. Kumar is still holding the weed. He doesn't know what to do. Harold is scared shitle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Tarik) Shit! Jackson's trying to escape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarik looks up from his book...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?     Oh, not again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops handcuff Nathaniel to the leg of a desk, and run over to the jail cell, ignoring Kumar and the weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop trying to escape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not trying to escape!        Look at me, I'm sitting down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn the key that is already in the keyhole and stor into the room. Harold stands back, confused. Tarik leans against the wall, ready to be handcuffed. The cops grab h and throw him down against the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to break free! Hold him tight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the midst of all the action, Kumar grabs Harold and pu him out of the cell. HAROLD GOES OVER TO PALUMBO'S DESK A PICKS UP HIS WALLET AND LAPTOP, along with the police rep They start running out of the room. Kumar's still clingin to the weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kumar) Wait-- shouldn't we do something about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harold) If I were you, I'd get out of here as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Harold and Kumar run out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR (still clinging to the weed) burst out t door and run down the steps. They race through the street and start heading towards a FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR have stopped running.   They start catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! That place was a fucking mad house! Thanks for getting me out of there, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, the burgers wouldn't taste as good if you weren't there. (beat, re: weed) Dude, look at this. It's like we went from being broke to being millionaires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, they hear what sounds like A COYOTE'S HOWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a coyote. Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES   MAY 28 2003   83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't people supposed to be scared of coyotes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's only because they sound scary. In one on one combat, either one of us can take a coyote down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now cheetahs, they're another story. The CHEETAH stares HAROLD and KUMAR down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just calm down. Cheetahs are used to eating zebras and shit. They're not known for eating humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll admit, that's not a good sign. But I'm sure if we just stay calm he'll probably leave us alone. HAROLD and KUMAR stand silently. SLOWLY, the CHEETAH begi walking directly over to HAROLD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Suddenly, the CHEETAH OPENS HIS MOUTH WIDE AND CHOMPS DOW WHAT APPEARS TO BE HAROLD'S GROIN AREA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes closed, screaming)

dialogues.speaker: HE'S MAULING ME
dialogues.text: HAROLD continues screaming for the next TEN SECONDS. Eventually, he calms down and looks at the CHEETAH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) I thought I told you not to take that jerky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD simply falls to the ground relieved that he hasn't been eaten. The Cheetah walks over to Harold and begins licking Harold's face in friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Kumar's eyes light up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I think I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, but first we have to get really high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar opens the bag of weed. Pan up to the night sky for a time lapse.   We see smoke coming up from below. Pan back down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Kumar are now sitting on top of the CHEETAH, smoking joints. Kumar has a belt around the cheetah's nec like reigns on a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it come to this?    Are we really gonna ride this cheetah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, cheetahs are the fastest animals on the planet. It's as good as a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar takes one last drag of a joint and flicks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is either a really smart move, or by far the stupidest thing we've ever done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD puts his arms around KUMAR to hold on.    Kumar pu bag of weed under his shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll soon find out. (like to a snow dog) Mush! Mush!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, am I just really high or is this is actually working?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great! We'll be at White Castle in no...

dialogues.speaker: SMACK
dialogues.text: CHEETAH. Harold lands on the ground-- his head bleeding. His eyes slowly close as he goes unconscious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LAND OF BURGERS is an OZ-like world-- the entire terr with all it's rolling hills, IS MADE UP OF HAMBURGERS. Mu plays as HAROLD and MARIA skip through THE LAND OF BURGER holding hands. Along the way, they run by... The BLACK GUYS from the BASKETBALL GAME, all waltzing wit each other, in white tuxedos. HUGEST ANGRIEST BLACK GUY gives Harold the same scary look from before.... FREAK SHOW is shoveling some burgers from the ground into wheelbarrow. He waves to Harold and Maria. He then takes a CHAINSAW and starts cutting off the arm he's waving wit KUMAR and the MALE NURSE, who are playing Twister, while getting high. After a spin of the wheel, Kumar reluctantl gets in a position where it looks like he's taking the Ma Nurse from behind. Kumar's not happy. Harold and Maria fall to the ground-- they roll down a hi UNTIL HAROLD IS ON TOP OF MARIA. Harold picks up a burger from the ground. Maria does the same. They proceed to fee each other their burgers. They munch on them, looking int each other's eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Harold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Maria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA gets up and runs away. HAROLD playfully chases her. Maria runs over to a FRENCH FRY TREE. SHE PLUCKS A COUPLE FRENCH FRIES FROM THE BRANCH AND FEEDS THEM TO HAROLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you guys are really extreme...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD turns and sees COLE KAYAKING DOWN A NEARBY STREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...extremely gay that is.

dialogues.speaker: STARTS GUSHING OUT. HE FALLS OFF THE KAYAK, INTO THE WATE
dialogues.text: HAROLD is shocked. He turns around and sees MARIA, HOLDIN CROSSBOW. She smiles at him. HE THEN JUMPS ON TOP OF HER AND THEY BEGIN MAKING LOVE ON TOP OF THE BURGERS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Harold! Yes! Yes! Oh, God-- you have the biggest dick of all time! It's so long! And wide, for that matter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Harold turns and sees the BURGER SHACK EMPLOYEE lying down near them. He is staring at them, with no expression on his face, with his hand down his pants-- rubbing his penis furiously. Harold is disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA rolls over so SHE'S ON TOP OF HAROLD. SHE STARTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD wakes up to find KUMAR LICKING HIS FACE.   HAROLD AWAY FROM HIM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES     MAY 28 2003   87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! You've been out cold for the past half-hour! I figured that maybe if I did some gay shit you'd wake up. HAROLD wipes his face with his sleeve. He then gets up-- sees that they are by a random road, all by themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the cheetah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ran away. But forget about that. I have some bad news and some worse news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the worse news first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked out some road signs. The cheetah took us in the wrong direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sucks.    What's the bad news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your laptop is completely destroyed. Kumar points to the laptop, which is outside of it's bag, broken in pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It smashed against a tree when you fell off the cheetah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell didn't you say that THAT was the "worse news"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the laptop really only effects you. Whereas the White Castle situation effects both of us equally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, dude. Your laptop's insured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that! All my work was saved in there! Now I gotta go back to the office and re-do everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. First, we'll take a cab over to White Castle, then we'll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget White Castle.   There's no time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Rold! You can get that shit done in a couple hours. We can't quit now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Kumar stand there, speechless, as Neil drives right past them, splashing a puddle in Harold's face! They stand there, watching silently as NEIL drives off. Harold is now drenched. Muddy water drips from his hair a clothing. He gives Kumar a dirty look. Kumar knows he shouldn't push Harold any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine...We'll find a pay phone and get a cab back to your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold, furious and almost in tears, simply nods "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar, disappointed, walks down the road with a miserable Harold. When they reach the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Look, there's a Krispee Kreme.     We'll call from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Kumar walk over to the parking lot. Unfortunat they notice a familiar YELLOW JEEP COVERED IN STICKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great.     Here we go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE and the EXTREME SPORTS PUNKS are hacky-sacking in th parking lot. Their skateboards are sitting nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kumar) Hey Apu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE laughs.   Kumar tries to ignore him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's running the Quik-E-Mart while you're gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE pounds fists with his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rold) Fucking asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, HAROLD stops in his tracks. He's noticed someth through the Krispee Kreme window. He stops KUMAR and points...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, we see ROSENBERG and GOLDSTEIN inside sitting at a booth. They both have a dozen donuts and fiv cartons of milk. It looks like they just sat down... Goldstein savors his first bite of his POWDERED BLUEBERRY FILLED DONUT and Rosenberg licks his fingers after his fi bite of his CHOCOLATE CREAM FILLED DONUT. HAROLD and KUMAR watch through the window longingly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES   MAY 28 2003   90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yearning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    A chocolate cream filled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I want that feeling. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feeling that comes over a man when he finally gets exactly what he desires. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I NEED that feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying what I think you're saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go to White Castle. KUMAR gives HAROLD a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!    I knew you had it in you! Suddenly, Kumar notices something else inside. Someone el is sitting down at Rosenberg & Goldstein's table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Cindy Kim? Harold watches as Cindy Kim sits down next to Goldstein. Goldstein puts his arm around her and feeds her a piece o donut. It looks like Goldstein and Cindy are "an item."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have boned her when you had the chance. Before Harold can respond, he's hit in the back of the he by a hacky sack! Cole and the Punks laugh at Harold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cole)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why don't you just leave us alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What are you gonna do about it, Mr. Miagi? Cole gets in the CRANE POSITION a la THE KARATE KID... Harold is quiet for a moment as he looks at Cole's little racist routine. He then lets out a little laugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold turns around and starts walking towards the Krispe Kreme entrance. Kumar follows. In the background Cole and Punks are laughing about what a "pussy" Harold is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off, but powerless) Fuck! I'm so sick of their bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally calm) Don't worry. The universe tends to unfold as it should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar gives a "What the fuck is he talking about?" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I have a plan.   Follow my lead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold walks past the Krispee Kreme entrance and heads towards the YELLOW JEEP at a brisk pace. KUMAR follows.

dialogues.speaker: JEEP AND RUSHES INSIDE THE DRIVER'S SIDE.
dialogues.text: One of the Extreme Sports Punks sees Harold doing this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Cole!   Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole turns to see Harold in his car. Kumar is about to ge in the passenger's side. Cole and the Punks start running towards the car! Kumar sees this and quickly gets inside. HAROLD puts the car in reverse, nearly hitting the punks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold is shifting gears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stealing their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold drives the car out of the parking lot.   Cole and Punks give chase on their skateboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Hey, slow down to like 25 mph, so they think they have a chance to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold drives COLE'S JEEP down at a speed just slow enoug for COLE and the PUNKS to think that they have a chance..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar then sticks his head out the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in thick Indian Accent) Thank you, come again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold guns it-- leaving Cole and the Punks in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Cole and the Punks watching in disbelief as Harold Kumar drive off with their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, that was so NOT extreme!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Extreme Sports Punk #1, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Extreme Sports Punks walk away, leaving Cole by himse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR are laughing and slapping five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victory is sweet! Nice job, Roldy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR begins sniffing something in the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.   Do you smell that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR keeps sniffing. He turns around to the back seat. H reaches back and picks something up from off the floor. I a WHITE CASTLE bag. He pours out the contents and we see EMPTY WHITE CASTLE HAMBURGER CARTONS fall onto Kumar's la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those assholes got to have White Castle?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This world is so unfair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry . Forget about that. We have a car now. We're back in the game. Pretty soon we'll be eating our own White Castle. Want me to drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've got everything under control. We should be able to get there with enough time for me to get my work done after our feast. Just find us some tunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tape is resting in the tape deck.   KUMAR pushes it in. HAROLD and KUMAR look at each other amazed that COLE has lame chick song on his tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys are fucking posers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see COLE'S YELLOW JEEP speeding along the highway. We signs indicating they're getting closer to Cherry Hill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Kumar are now listening to another lame chick song. While they aren't fully embracing the song, it's cl they're kind of enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys take the Cherry Hill exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Kumar are singing along passionately to a thir lame chick song. 123   EXT. HIGHWAY - 6:25 A.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, we're almost there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're speeding down a road lined by forests on both sid We see the Jeep speeds by a COP CAR... 126   INT. COP CAR - 6:30 A.M. OFFICER BRUCKS (middle-aged, tough, toothpick in his mout sees the yellow jeep speed by. He reloads his rifle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR are still singing... All of a sudden, HAROLD and KUMAR hear a POLICE SIREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR turns around and sees the police car behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER BRUCKS is speaking into his POLICE RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found them. And I'm gonna need back-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COP CAR is tailing the Jeep. The Jeep pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Brucks sees the jeep pull away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into police radio) Oh boy! We got a chase on our hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD looks determined as he puts the pedal to the metal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going back to jail!     We've come too far! Now buckle up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buckle up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar buckles his seat belt.   HAROLD MAKES A SHARP TURN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YELLOW JEEP goes around a turn in the road and then C INTO THE FOREST, DISAPPEARING IN THE WOODS... We then see the COP CAR go around the turn. It passes by point where HAROLD and KUMAR entered the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From OFFICER BRUCKS'S POV, we see that he has a long stre ahead, with no cars in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his foot on the brakes, bringing the car to a screeching halt. OFFICER BRUCKS gets out of the car and looks around wonde where the YELLOW JEEP went. HE THEN HEARS THE SOUND OF BRANCHES CRACKING IN THE WOODS... 134   EXT. WOODS - 6:35 A.M. The Jeep bounces up and down as it heads uphill in the wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold is holding onto the wheel for dear life. Kumar is scared as shit. They're both bouncing up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep continues going uphill, higher and higher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Kumar are still bouncing up and down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing I have an empty stomach, or else I'd puke right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We're gonna make it. Everything's gonna be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!                               Fuck! HAROLD HITS THE BRAKES AS HARD AS HE CAN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the jeep stop just short of the cliff. Harold and Kumar get out of the jeep and walk over to the edge of th cliff and look down. IT'S A VERY STEEP DROP. SUDDENLY, KUMAR SEES SOMETHING OUT IN THE DISTANCE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Rold! Look out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!   We're trapped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kumar notices something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR walks over to the JEEP and points to the HANG-GLIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No way. Not a chance.       I'd rather turn myself in than die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, it's okay. I used to hang-glide with my dad all the time when I was kid. I know how to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hang-glided? I don't remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it on our trips   to India. I swear. I know exactly    what I'm doing. I've even done it with   two people at the same time. My brother    and I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES MAY 28 2003       97. KUMAR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold onto the outside bars and let me take care of the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Kumar. I'm not risking my life over a bunch of hamburgers. KUMAR walks over to HAROLD and stares him in the eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this just about the burgers, huh? Well, let me tell you-- it's about far more than that. KUMAR walks over to the edge of the cliff and looks out o the EARLY MORNING HORIZON. The sun is still rising. The scene is very picturesque...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our parents came to this country, escaping persecution, poverty, and hunger. Hunger, Harold. They were very, very hungry. And they wanted to live in a land that treated them as equals. A land where their kids could study and get into good colleges. A land filled with hamburger stands. And not just one type of hamburger. Hundreds of types-- with different sizes, toppings, and condiments. That land was America. THE POLICE SIREN IS GETTING LOUDER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Rold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is just about the burgers? No. This is about achieving what our parents set out for. This is about the pursuit of happiness. This is about the American dream. KUMAR walks over to HAROLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so we've reached this point. The point which all men eventually have to face. The point of no return. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can stay here, get arrested and end our hopes of ever going to White Castle. Or we can take the hang-glider and make our leap towards freedom. I leave the decision up to you. From the sound of the sirens, it seems that the police ar getting closer. Harold turns back, facing Kumar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you, Kumar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up...they're almost here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab onto the end of the bars and hold on tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD does as he's told. They are both holding onto the bars (Harold behind Kumar).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Here's how this is gonna work. On the count of three, we're gonna run to the edge of the cliff. When I say "jump," launch yourself forward as if you were diving into a pool, got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry-- everything's gonna be fine. Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD's too nervous to speak.   KUMAR gets into position

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here goes. One...two...three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR START RUNNING TOWARDS THE CLIFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, Rold! Keep running!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rold, there's something I gotta tell you. I've never hang-glided before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMP!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hang glider coasts through the air for a couple secon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!    Oh my God!   Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, it's working!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you lied to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how else was I gonna convince you to jump off a cliff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER BRUCKS gets out of the car, holding his rifle and runs over to the jeep. He looks inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the walkie-talkie) It appears they've escaped. They ditched their jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER BRUCKS opens the front door of the car and peers inside. He notices THE BAG OF WEED ON THE DASHBOARD. He opens it and TASTES SOME WEED in the same way a drug cop would taste cocaine during a bust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the walkie-talkie) Good news. I found enough dope in the car to send those skateboard punks to jail for the next couple years. Looks like they've terrorized their last convenience store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Officer Brucks realizes that the taste in his m is strangely appealing. He thinks for a beat as he eyes t bag of weed. He then takes another taste of it. He looks again at the bag. Like Kumar, we can tell that he's in love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER BRUCKS and the BAG OF WEED drink bottles of BUDWE while sitting in the back of a PICKUP TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCKS is skeet shooting, as the BAG OF WEED watches. gives the bag a kiss, after a successful round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCKS is having sex with the bag doggy-style.    He slap "ass" as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCKS hugs and caresses the BAG OF WEED, as he's lost in fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our triumphant heros are gliding across the morning sky. Harold and Kumar look down as they soar above the trees..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, we're so high right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue gliding though the sky for a while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Kumar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we gonna get down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...well...I guess it's just gonna go down at some point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great answer. Made me feel really comfortable. Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR looks down as they fly over a playground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a problem if we fly into birds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES    MAY 28 2003    101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're about to! KUMAR looks up and sees at least A HUNDRED CROWS FLYING STRAIGHT TOWARDS THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! HAROLD AND KUMAR FLY RIGHT INTO THE CROWS.   Numerous bir collide with their faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh!   My eyes! Don't peck out my eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna die! We're gonna die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you!   I hate you so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna live! Ha! Ha! We're gonna live! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Rold? That wasn't so bad.

dialogues.speaker: FINALLY-- THEY STOP ROLLING WHEN THEY HIT HARD PAVEMENT.
dialogues.text: HAROLD gets up before he can catch his breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathing heavily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it...I'm gonna kill you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop...I...can't...breathe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Rold...look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Kumar walk inside. Their shirts are torn and tattered, their bodies are scratched up, and they're cove in dirt. Everyone in the restaurant turns and stares at t They approach the counter, where A TEENAGER STANDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you guys had some night, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold and Kumar look at each other, and then back at the teenager. Their expressions are stone cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want thirty slyders. I want five french fries. I want four large Cherry cokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same.    Only make mine Diet Cokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That comes to...forty-two dollars and seventy-five cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR take out their WALLETS.     THEY OPEN TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...hey...hey...where's my money?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES    MAY 28 2003   103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have money?! Shit, I gave all mine to that asshole at Princeton! Fuck that hippie fuck! This can't be happening! We're so close and we're fucking broke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take care of it. HAROLD and KUMAR turn around and see NEIL PATRICK HARRIS finishing his coke. He throws it in the trash. HAROLD and KUMAR are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys kept talking about White Castle last night. It made me start craving it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my fucking car you prick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sorry about that. Like I said, I was tripping balls last night. I don't know what came over me. Your car's out in the parking lot. Here are the keys. NEIL tosses HAROLD the car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize what we had to go through after you stole the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It was a dick move on my part. That's why I'm paying for your meal. Harold and Kumar look at each other, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I guess. NEIL hands them some cash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's fifty for the meal, and two hundred for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES    MAY 28 2003   104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made some love stains in the back seat. You'll see. Anyway, take it easy guys. I'll see you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever God takes me. With that, NEIL walks out of the restaurant.   HAROLD and KUMAR look at each other, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys...it's gonna take a little while to make all those burgers. You might as well sit down. HAROLD and KUMAR walk over to a booth and take a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, we're here. Isn't it great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I can't believe we made it. AND we got the car back! If we can just get out of here in a half hour, I can get back to my office and get the work done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look! KUMAR points to a TV in the corner of the restaurant. screen we see A MORNING NEWS SHOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's top story...Rutgers professor Tarik Jackson and attorney Nathaniel Banks are suing the state of New Jersey for racial discrimination and police brutality. We go live to the municipal state courthouse in Muckleburg... Tarik and Nathaniel have a bunch of microphones in front them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened last night was a complete moral travesty. My family and I are outraged and will not settle for anything less than justice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES   MAY 28 2003   105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Tarik joined by his parents (Two Old Gay Black Men one is comforting the other). Nathaniel walks in front of the microphone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very professional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by justice, we mean somewhere in the ballpark of ten million dollars....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kumar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, good for those black guys!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TELEVISION
dialogues.text: We see footage of OFFICER PALUMBO and THE OTHER COPS take away in handcuffs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not racist! This is bullshit! If those black bastards think they're gonna get away with this, they've got another thing coming! Me and my white buddies are gonna [bleep] them up! Officer Palumbo gets shoved forcefully into the back of a police car. Harold and Kumar enjoy this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just in...police have arrested a gang of hooligans... We see a picture of COLE and the EXTREME SPORTS PUNKS in corner of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...after they found their abandoned car in the forest in Clifton, containing a large bag of marijuana. The young men could face up to five years in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR slap five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally...the Muckleburg Police Department has informed us that they ARE STILL looking for ANOTHER FUGITIVE who escaped from the Police Station last night, along with a companion, believed to be his accomplice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD'S JAW DROPS. He's scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police have made the following sketch of the two fugitives, which they believe to be quote "extremely accurate."

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN, WE SEE A HORRIBLE POLICE SKETCH OF "HAROLD
dialogues.text: and "KUMAR"-- IT IS BASICALLY AN ASIAN MAN IN HIS SEVENTI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harold and Kumar) Hey, guys...I got your orders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR run out of the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR have put three tables together, on which see SIXTY WHITE CASTLE HAMBURGERS-- EACH ONE STEAMING HOT TWO GOOD-LOOKING GUYS (JON and HAYDEN) stare at Harold an Kumar's orders, amazed by their size. They then look at their own orders and realize how worthless they are. HAROLD and KUMAR are sitting across from one another, loo at the smorgasbord in front of them. HAROLD IS ABOUT TO D IN, BUT KUMAR STOPS HIM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...let's do it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES   MAY 28 2003   106A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR have finished their meals. They both loo full and satisfied. Harold takes one last sip of his soda

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...that hit the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the best meal of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them sit there, looking at all the empty containers and wrappers. After a long pause of silence, KUMAR speaks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you know what? I think I may actually go to my interview today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You know, my whole life I've been afraid being just another nerdy Indian guy turned doctor. Well, tonight got me thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are far worse things in the world than being tagged for having a natural ability in medicine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD pretends to be listening to KUMAR-- BUT HE IS MORE FOCUSED ON BILLY AND J.D., who get out of the car with th women and start walking towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like having boils all over your face. Or dealing with the shit those black guys had to go through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not paying attention) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES   MAY 28 2003   108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I have to admit, it felt pretty cool saving that guy's life last night. Somewhere between that, getting yelled at by my dad, and seeing Neil Patrick Harris, I realized that I've always wanted to be a doctor-- I've just been too scared to admit it. KUMAR sees that HAROLD isn't paying attention...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rold, are you listening to me?   I'm having a major epiphany here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back... At that moment, BILLY and J.D. walk in the restaurant wit their women, ZOE and TRACY, respectively. TRACY looks lik some bimbo slut that J.D. picked up at a strip club. ZOE, the other hand, has a sweet RENEE ZELLWEGER quality about her. She and Billy are the perfect Hollywood couple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Billy-- you paying for this or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there in a second... J.D. and TRACY check out the menu. BILLY takes ZOE aside- whatever their story is, it seems to have reached the "yo complete me" moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I have to admit something to you. At the start of last night, all I really cared about was getting some. But then I met you, Zoe. You're so different from all the other women I've ever met. You're smart, funny, artistic. I guess what I'm trying to say is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on here? BILLY turns around and sees HAROLD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold?   What are you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind me. What are you doing here? I thought you and J.D. were busy all night with "clients." Isn't that why I had to do YOUR work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES   MAY 28 2003   109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.D. hears the commotion and turns around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, cock boy! What I have to say to him goes double for you! KUMAR sees what's going on-- he can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cock boy? I'm sorry, but did you just call me "cock boy?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know I did. You're just stalling because you're not quick enough to think of a comeback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not quick enough? (to Billy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks I'm not quick enough. (to Harold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got news for you... (long beat, thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am quick enough... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...cock boy! J.D. is embarrassed. BILLY tries to placate the situation

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Billy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even bother with him.   We'll just tell Berenson later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him what? That I'm your work horse! That you guys think you can just party all weekend and leave all your work to the quiet Asian guy in your office! Huh? J.D. is stunned.   Now he's a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no-- you don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, YOU don't understand. I'm not doing your work anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD (cont'd) And if either one of you douchebags ever tries to pull this shit again, I'll go to Berenson and tell him what's really going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold notices Traci and Zoe listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll tell everyone in the office how you both caught gonorrhea from that whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACI and ZOE hear this and are freaked out.   They slowl back away from BILLY and J.D....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to get going. See you on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD leaves the RESTAURANT. KUMAR follows.     Billy an are left embarrassed and in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAROLD and KUMAR walk over to Harold's Infiniti...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Rold! Where the hell did that come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Eating those delicious burgers made me feel like a new man. Now I'm actually looking forward to work this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit! I guess you're worthwhile after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So those dudes have gonorrhea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me. (beat) Now, come on, let's get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the rush? There's plenty of time before my interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some unfinished business to take care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both get into the car (Harold gets in the driver's side). The car zooms out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. Harold and Kumar exit. Kumar giv Harold a pat on the back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KUMAR stands behind, while HAROLD approaches MARIA'S door HAROLD TAKES A DEEP BREATH AND THEN KNOCKS ON THE DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) Oh...uh...nothing...wrong room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back to bed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to woman) Hey, Papi's coming! Hold on! (to Harold, laughing) This girl is crazy, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES MAY 28 2003       112. LUIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seemed so sweet at first, but it turns out she's into some pretty freaky shit. She even did this thing where she took a lollipop and shoved it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grossed out/depressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I really don't need to hear it. I guess I just made a mistake. Sorry for interrupting you guys... Harold starts to walk away, almost crying. SAD, DEPRESSIN MUSIC BEGINS TO PLAY. Kumar feels sorry for his friend. Just then, Luis leans his head out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-- if you're looking for Maria, she left for Europe this morning. Harold quickly turns around and runs back over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to Amsterdam for ten days. I'm Luis -- Maria's brother. Luis shakes Harold's hand.    Harold suddenly feels bette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!    Maria's brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be that Chinese guy Maria keeps talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm Kor...wait a second-- she talks about me? A HOT BLACK CHICK (AISHA), wearing only a bra and g-strin walks over to Luis and wraps her arms around him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll be there in a second, baby. Do me a favor-- make me that omelette you were talking about. You know, with the sun-dried tomatoes. Aisha kisses him, and walks away to the kitchen. Luis giv her a little a slap on the ass. Harold doesn't quite know how to respond to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUBLE WHITE REVISED PAGES   MAY 28 2003   113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want me to leave her a message or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no thanks. I'd rather do it in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take it easy, hermano. Luis shuts the door.    Kumar runs over to Harold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude...we gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?   Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Amsterdam! We can pack up right now and take the next plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Are you out of your mind? What about your interview with the med school guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. I'll tell my dad to reschedule it. He won't have a problem, as long as I'm taking it seriously for a change. Now, let's fly to Europe and find Maria!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming back in ten days! It's not like I'm never gonna see her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a hot chick, ten days in Europe is the kiss of death. There are gonna be suave, sophisticated guys all over her. By the time she gets back, she may not be available. Harold feels a little nervous about what Kumar is saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.   I'll just wait till she comes back. Harold starts to walk away from Kumar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rold!   Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do realize what's legal in Amsterdam, right?
